title: If your cat pulled specific books off the bookshelf would you think he is trying to tell you something? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. I have felt at different times that my cats were trying to pass me messages from my deceased parents. I have a female cat that I always say is the reincarnation of my mother, because she reminds me so much of my mother sometimes. She has a similar character and sometimes looks at me with a certain look or does things that are so much like my mother. Recently I was doing something and thinking that, if my mother were alive and saw me doing that, she’d start yelling that it was time to eat and to drop already what I was doing. (My mother always used food as a way to pull herself and others from situations that were emotionally uncomfortable for her). What I was doing was something my mother would’ve felt uncomfortable with. In that same moment, my cat suddenly came up to me and, with great annoyance, started meowing loudly demanding to be fed right now. (If anyone is curious, what I was doing was going deep into information I had found about my mother’s ancestors and finding certain patterns, as part of my family tree project)

I don’t think there’d be any latent message buried in the titles of the books, or anything like that. Any books that I keep in hardcopy on my shelf are likely ones that I like, so he could pull any of them down and I could construct a message from them. What he might be trying to tell me would be something like “I’m bored,” or “I’m hungry,” or perhaps “I think there’s a mouse hiding behind the books.”
